author: wada
title: Wada Web3 Education DAO Valuation
description: Most impact orgs like Wada struggle financially due to improper value capture as an investment vehicle. This leads to unrealized benefits of impact ventures and monetary loss for potential investors

f6_assessments.q0: With all the content WADA has produced, it only seems logical that they at some point monetize it in order to be self-sufficient. As this will both free up funds (while still a lot of good work will be performed by WADA) and provide a useful framework that can be applied elsewhere as well, so it will definetely be beneficial to the Cardano ecosystem and also in the regard that it will help with the scalability of monetizing educational content on the blockchain. It also matches well into the challenge as it can definetely generate a lot of impact.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, WADA have consistently proven that they are able to deliver on the proposals they get funded for. The proposal team are all well-known and have proven to be competent. They present a working implementation plan and a reaonable budget. A contingency plan is presented as well.
f6_assessments.q2: The problem statement is clear, and a comprehensible solution is presented that can be audited. Actually, Audits are already part of the process. Apart from this, with the detailed roadmap and the success metrics this project should be auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
To fully appreciate the value created, it is crucial to measure and manage an organization's potential for commercial and cultural value.
This proposal creates and incorporates a distributed governance model, or DAO, using established and newly developed technologies, standards, and procedures.
The value framework for this project could help other businesses with their pertinent work through education.
f6_assessments.q1: The Wada organization currently includes a core international oversight and local groups that are working to use blockchain to build inclusive systems in Africa and communities. They are knowledgeable about blockchain and have experience with it. by putting in place training and education initiatives that support the growth of the blockchain community in Africa.
f6_assessments.q2:
"Project milestones were completed on schedule and within budget (Project management and monitoring tool)
The project has a well defined scope, specified team members, and defined duties (completed Project setup)
In the exploratory phase, gaps are clearly established. (Assessment of the audit documents' quality)
A standardized, user-friendly tool for data gathering has been designed (Experiential questionnaire)
Focus group meetings and seminars draw a large audience and are interesting (number of consistent attendees)
Clarity of vision and strategy declarations, company and investment strategies, and usability of valuation framework methodology"
To assess project progress, all information is complete and understandable.

f6_assessments.q0: We observed that the creation of a method that helps to assess the impact fits well with the objectives of the challenge, since the better measurement of beneficial effects, as mentioned in the proposal, helps to bring more investment and engagement. If such benefits were brought only to the WADA organization, we would have that the proposal would already be interesting, but we see that the model being developed could be used for several other projects, indicating an even more positive impact for the Cardano ecosystem. Furthermore, considering the factors mentioned above, we see that the budget being requested seems quite fair, and in addition, we have as a positive factor the background of WADA, which is already well known in our ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the ways explained for the execution of the project, we noticed a very broad understanding of which factors must be taken into account for the project to achieve its objectives. The most positive point about viability seems to be the close monitoring of the factors that can make a company more valuable, but that are not always seen by external agents. As WADA already operates and has experience in exactly this field, its partnership with Edify Business is likely to present great synergy, with key points to extract maximum value from the deals being discovered. We can also indicate this because the professionals involved in the project have extensive experience in projects, especially related to Africa. And to find out about this, you can find the WADA organization's LinkedIn and there, we find links to the profiles of the professionals involved. Regarding budget detail, we were able to find consistent allocations, with the largest amounts being allocated to important actions for the execution of the project. It is also interesting to see that one of the largest amounts ($5,000) is earmarked for research and data validation.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the ways chosen to follow the evolution of the project, we see interesting metrics that are concerned not only with the delivery of the product, but also with the ease and effectiveness of its result. However, in the perception of the project's success, it would be interesting if quantitative goals, which were related to the parameters described above, had been mentioned. This would make it easier to assess whether the project was successful or not. Such goals could be, for example, an average number of projects using the tool or a survey with these projects, to understand if the usability is adequate.

f6_assessments.q0: The project is of high value to the Cardano ecosystem and represents a president that will be followed by many organizations whether educational or not that are affiliated with Cardano. The presented indeed falls under the guidelines on the challenge since it presents a novel way to measure the value of non-profit organizations using a DAO structure. Furthermore, the Wada organization is already notorious for its impact so far in Africa when it comes to educating and creating future contributions to the ecosystem. Although the organization mainly targets Africa its content can still be accessible for everyone which is a big enough impact, especially with their new model which represents a paradigm shift in the space. Moreover, the project already showcased an immense ability to scale which raises the confidence that this project will be no different.
f6_assessments.q1:
From the comprehensive presentation of the team and according to the links provided and the notoriarity of the team and its history of delivery, it becomes easy to predict a high chance of success. For starters, the team has indeed the expertise needed for such a project which can be easily seen from the links provided and their past work. Furthermore, they provide a detailed timeframe on a weekly basis including what exactly will be done that successfully manage expectations and set standards. Also, the budget is broken down into specific needs like research, setup, and auditing...
The team doesn't specify too many risks (mainly two) but they do indeed discuss them carefully and provide ways to mitigate them. On the other hand, the detailed planning and extensive information provided makes up for that since it showcases a well-thought-of project. While such a project is not trivial, it is crucial to the growth of the non-profit organizations in the ecosystem and especially the educational ones. It also answers a real need that has been long discussed in the space and the approach that Wada is taking seems promising.
f6_assessments.q2:
The nature of the project is open-source and also the nature of the organization working on it makes auditing and follow-ups significantly easier since all advancements would be made public as they should be. The team makes it clear that they will provide various valuation metrics such as documentation, number of consistent attendees, and data collection tool,...
The roadmap is clear and very promising. Furthermore, the milestones that the project seeks to achieve are not too ambitious as a way to manage expectations. Many KPIs can be considered here, as said the earlier number of consistent attendees is one, alternative budgets raised, as well as the follow-ups on the business plan. The delivery dates are broken down into weekly timeframes with details on what needs to be achieved in the period from research phases to different activities and so on. These details overall showcase a lot of clarity from the team and ease of auditability of the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal poses an interesting approach to the problem that many entities inside and outside the blockchain industry may suffer from, which, in the words of the authors is "Traditional accounting methods of valuing a business do not recognize the full commercial or cultural value that it has created". For this, Wada established a partnership with Edify Colab who has already applied this method in other institutions outside the industry. This proposal will allow the creation of a prototype to evaluate the Web3 Education DAO, and enable the basis for Wada and similar organizations to develop strategies that will allow them to monetize their projects. This could be attractive for different organizations, both in Cardano and Cardashift, as it enables the possibility of attracting more and better investors.
f6_assessments.q1: An implementation plan comprised of 6 phases is presented. Each phase is complemented with a brief description of what is expected to be done, to complement the actions to be carried out on a weekly / monthly basis. Now, taking into account that Edify is the one who would be doing most of the work, I would have expected a description of the individuals from Edify who would be assigned to this project. The budget was based on the actions within the plan, and presents the cost per hour according to the type of activity to be performed. It would have been helpful (especially for activities that are associated with higher costs per hour) if you could present the professional profile expected to perform these tasks. Risks are identified, and mitigation measures are described in an appropriate manner.
f6_assessments.q2: The intrinsic characteristic of this project being open source makes this project have high auditability by default, plus the possibility to follow up due to the clear roadmap provided. Although I would have liked to see more tangible metrics of success, deliverables such as "audit documents assessed" and "number of consistent attendees" can be taken as signs of success. These seem to me to be appropriate in this case because of the nature of this project. For the same reason, I think the description of "What does success for this project look like" seems appropriate.

f6_assessments.q0: WADA is a name in the Cardano Community, especially in the African context and around the globe. This Web3 Education is very much reliable for the community for early adopters. The partnership with Edify Colab and other offline businesses will be very interesting to see what opportunities might emerge. The Cardashift launchpad will also benefit from this, as I am not sure about the relation of this proposal for the main sponsor (which is CardaShift platforms.) about how to monetize impacts. Risks are also mentioned with the business deprioritizes and no deliverable outcomes. The team also mentioned mitigations actions.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline is broken down into 5 phases with the monthly /weekly phasing. The first 3 months are only for setting up and month 4 for the focus group. The output only comes in the final 2 months, there should be a stop sign if the project cannot deliver the mentioned milestones. The budget is allocated based on the 5 phases. And an over project manager to supervise the whole project management. The team is transparent with the 4 team members of Wada member as lead. There should be a link attached for each member so that the community can research further.
f6_assessments.q2: The OKRs/KPIs are broken down by each tracking metric both quantitative and qualitative. The success of this project is  a template framework for Wad and Wada's Web 3 Education DAO which also stated in a parallel project https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/419058 I am not sure how much this will impact this challenge setting especially for Cardashift and the related of this for the overlapping of the 2 projects (with a very similar name at 2 different challenges.)

solution: Templating a valuation method for Wada's Web3 Education DAO will ensure that we maximize impact funding & investment, plus create tooling for other community orgs in the Cardano ecosystem to utilize
experience: Wada is a Cardano-based network of 100+ professionals focused on connecting the world to Africa using blockchain and AI, and with a consistent project delivery record. Edify's expertise spans every aspect of business from commercial and financial through to culture and strategy.
